abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Coastal Cities Pollution
            Control Project for Croatia were as follows: outcomes were
            moderately satisfactory, the risk to development outcome was
            low or negligible, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: as in all projects, a high
            level of borrower commitment and capacity is essential for
            successful project implementation and ensuring
            sustainability. Adaptable program loans are suitable for
            reaching long-term objectives in sectors such as wastewater
            management through a measurable phased approach and
            subsequent phases provide the Bank and the Government with
            the opportunity to improve project design and performance.
            Performance monitoring indicators should be carefully
            selected to be able to fully capture achievement of the
            project/program development objectives. Investment
            surcharges from users can be an effective means to reveal
            demand and improve sustainability of investments.
